TEXT.TITLE: SECURITIES TRADE GROUP REPLIES TO SENATE VOTE
TEXT.BODY: The Securities Industry Association said it strongly supports the decision yesterday by the Senate Banking Committee to freeze the entry by commerical banks into non-banking businesses such as the underwriting of commerical paper. "This committee vote is not only a prudent and thoughtful approach to review of the Glass-Steagall Act, but a strong and needed message from the Senate that it is the responsibility of Congress to review, and if necessary, amend the nation's banking laws," the association said in a statement. Reuter
